data

Class Automaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.Automaton

  • public class Automaton
extends java.lang.Object
    An Automaton is the main class that will hold information of all the machine.

    It contains the alphabet and a list of all the starting states. Any manipulation have to be done on the automaton directly

    Author:
    Aldric Vitali Silvestre

      • addState

        public boolean addState(State state,
                        boolean isInitial,
                        boolean isFinal)
        Add a state to the current list of states of the automaton. If the id of the state is already used, a new one will be assigned to it
        Parameters:
        state - the state to add to the automaton
        isInitial - if the state is an initial state
        isFinal - if the state is a final state
        Returns:
        if the state was succefully added

      • getMaxIdValue

        public int getMaxIdValue()

      • addState

        public boolean addState(State state)
        Add a state that is not initial nor final to the current list of states of the automaton
        Parameters:
        state - the state to add to the automaton
        Returns:
        true if the state was succefully added

      • removeState

        public boolean removeState(int stateId)
        Remove a state from the automaton
        Parameters:
        stateId - the id of the state to remove
        Returns:
        if the state was successfully removed

      • addTransition

        public boolean addTransition(State startingState,
                             State destinationState,
                             char letter)
        Add a transition between two states
        Parameters:
        startingState - the state where the transition starts
        destinationState - the state where the transition starts
        letter - the letter that "holds" the transition
        Returns:
        if the transition was successfully added

      • addEpsilonTransition

        public boolean addEpsilonTransition(State startingState,
                                    State destinationState)
        Add an espilon transition from a state to another.

        Same as calling addTransition(State, State, char) with character '\0000'

        Parameters:
        startingState - the state where the transition starts
        destinationState - the state where the transition starts
        Returns:
        if the transition was successfully added
